name: Bongo
description: The Bongo is a striking antelope with reddish-brown fur and white stripes, native to African forests.
spread_note: Found in East Africa, particularly Kenya and Uganda.
food_note: Nocturnal feeders, often browsing in dense vegetation.
proportions: Height: 1.1-1.3 m, length: 2-2.5 m, weight: 200-400 kg.
reproduction: Gestation lasts about 9 months, typically one calf born.
attractions: Rare in zoos due to their elusive nature, a favorite for conservation displays.
projects_note: Critically endangered; breeding programs aim to boost populations.
breeding: Captive breeding programs are active but challenging.
